author: 0xsadcat
content:
Bomb under PoS makes ethereum fragile. It made sense under PoW because miners are an external unaligned entity and it's only a temp phase. Eth stakers are directly invested in ethereum.
The only after-merge feature that's directly necessary for ethereum to survive are withdrawals.

Sounds grim, but right now if a bomb goes off at devcon or some other major ethereum conference ethereum is over. Same with circumstances that make it impossible to coordinate a fork (what if WW3 starts and every single core dev below 60 is drafted?). There would be nobody left with enough social capital to coordinate an obviously dominant fork. Without a bomb, ethereum would just survive as-is potentially forever.

Alternatively, right now it's very hard to reject a fork with eg. forced kyc if all main devs were to be forced by their governments. It's much, much easier for normal users to reject a bad fork than it is to organize a competing one.

I hope that war in Ukraine is enough empirical proof that history hasn't ended and extreme deviations from the status quo can indeed happen.

For these reasons I think difficulty bomb should be gone forever when the merge happens.
